channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou jets off to Palma to investigate a yacht thought to be worth £150,000, while Prestige Pawnbrokers' memorabilia expert Lawrence values a guitar signed by Oasis. An impressive diamond bracelet gives new branch manager Alicja a chance to secure an international client and a vivacious prospective customer hopes the proceeds from the sale of a set of designer handbags might help get a new business venture off the ground.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Steve have three properties to show Andy and Jo Green for their 100,000 euro budget, but are put on the back foot when the couple change their brief halfway through.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Special needs teacher Kerry Smith seeks a holiday home in southern Spain, but her limited budget forces her to consider properties more inland than she would have wished.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Randy DeWitt, the CEO and co-founder of bar and grill chain Twin Peaks, goes undercover to find out whether the company's culture is keeping up with its rapid growth. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples host dinner parties in Dartford and Beckenham, with Jamie and Carol, Paul and Justin, and Richard and Julie all competing for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glasgow pair Jean and Ron hope their `taste of Scotland' menu will impress their guests. Day two sees Colin and Craig try to claw back the limelight and jolly up the mood.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Newbury Park in southern California to help Mexican restaurant Mama Rita's. The owner previously ran a successful catering company but has struggled to adapt her skills to meet the demands of a new business - and with a year's worth of food stored in the freezer Gordon realises he has a tough job ahead.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of the owners of Hannah & Mason's, a French bistro in Cranbury, New Jersey. Members of staff complain their pay cheques bounce, and the kitchen cooler is so unhygienic that Gordon makes the decision to close the restaurant on Valentine's Day - the busiest night of the year.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton heads for the south of France to help a passionate Francophile locate the perfect retirement property. Meanwhile, Luke Doonan is approached by the woman's youngest daughter, who is concerned about her mother's plans to emigrate and asks him to find an alternative home in Cornwall.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton come to the aid of creative couple Victor and Penny from London. The pair are searching for a relaxing getaway and must choose between buying a home in Kent, which would make for an easy weekend commute, or finding a property in Penny's preferred location, Florence in Italy.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps first-time buyers Lucy and Joe, who have set their heart on a cottage in the Cotswolds, where they can start a family. However, Joe wants a project and has already discounted hundreds of potential homes online, so it looks like he's going to be hard to please. Phil's search is just as difficult in Bristol, where country boy Paul and city girl Elly want a home with outside space that's close to the railway station. Finding somewhere that ticks all the boxes could be tricky.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Expensive Food
programme.desc: London is home to more billionaires than any other city on the planet and they use a private network of luxury food suppliers. This two-part documentary follows the companies who cater to them, with the opening episode examining how businesses must adapt and fight harder than ever before to win a foothold in this lucrative new market.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The eagle-eyed armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The eagle-eyed armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: An elephant calf, Indali, is born at Chester Zoo, but her young half-sister Nandita doesn't welcome the new arrival. Meanwhile, Bush dog dad Franco is under pressure as his family grows, and Apple, an onager - a rare type of wild horse - faces a major operation.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Restaurants with Michel Roux Jr
programme.desc: Michel's journey brings him to the West Country and Wales, as he searches for secret eateries and food mavericks in remote and often bizarre places. On his travels he discovers hidden restaurants inside a garden shed, a staff canteen and a Victorian walled kitchen garden, before visiting a highly-celebrated crab shack. Later, Michel travels to London with his friend and chef Freddy Bird, and the pair meet a couple who want to turn an old barge into a fine-dining fish restaurant on the Isles of Scilly.(n)

programme.title: Homeland
programme.desc: Carrie catches a break, Keane makes a plan and Max goes undercover. Drama, starring Claire Danes, Rupert Friend and Elizabeth Marvel.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jane Grote Abell, the Chairwoman of Donatos Pizza and daughter of the company's founder, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win money to open her own restaurant. Her aim is to uncover where the company is going, what plans for the future should include and whether her father's values are still being upheld.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Anthony Wedo, President and CEO of Buffets, Inc, goes undercover to find out what his staff members are really like. He was brought on to the team to turn the firm around after years of challenges and poses as a construction worker to find out the flaws in the business.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: More customers arrive at Prestige Pawnbrokers, including a woman and her son, who are hoping to secure a loan against a 71-carat tanzanite ring they bought from a home-shopping channel. Prestige boss James Constantinou takes a shine to a bespoke show motorbike, and must fight against his instinct to claim the vehicle for himself as he seeks a buyer. Plus, a collection of 500 handbags arrives for valuation.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Michelle and Adrian Bohanna are looking to upsize to a villa with a pool, and have tasked Casas Manuel with finding them their dream home from home.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: In Ashurst Wood, West Sussex, the property expert helps to modernise a cluttered 1950s home so retired couple Tim and Gina can take the unusual step of upsizing. In Weybridge, Surrey, he visits a not-so-Swinging Sixties pad inherited by siblings Nigel and Beverley, who need to bring their property up to scratch before potential buyers arrive.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steven Newman, CEO of department store chain Loehmann's, views his company from a different perspective when he goes undercover as an aspiring entrepreneur visiting the shops after winning a reality TV contest - and learns first-hand that the employees are the foundation of the company.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Northamptonshire, loved-up luvvies Anna and Coylah hope their menu will reflect their personalities, while Felicity and Lawrence, and Martin and Dawn also compete.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples host dinner parties in Bedfordshire, with Gavin and Jodie, Francis and Yvonne, and Lisa and Ed all competing for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Le Bistro in Lighthouse Point, Florida, where the stubborn chef and owner has lost his passion for cooking. The visiting expert hopes to help, but his criticisms are not well received, causing tempers to flare.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Italian family restaurant Sabatiello's in Stamford, Connecticut, where the owner's fiery temper upsets the staff and has left him more than $1million in debt. Gordon's help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Two house-hunters wish to relocate somewhere they can grow their own vegetables and indulge their love of culture, so experts Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman are on hand to show them a variety of properties in Dorset and Croatia to aid them in making their decision.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps first-time buyers Lucy and Joe, who have set their heart on a cottage in the Cotswolds, where they can start a family. However, Joe wants a project and has already discounted hundreds of potential homes online, so it looks like he's going to be hard to please. Phil's search is just as difficult in Bristol, where country boy Paul and city girl Elly want a home with outside space that's close to the railway station. Finding somewhere that ticks all the boxes could be tricky.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Jan Fursier has discovered in one of her father Reg's diaries an illustrated guide to building a 1930s caravan, drawn up while he was being held in a Japanese prisoner of war camp. George Clarke and Will Hardie attempt to bring the caravan to life, leading to an emotional reunion in the same Welsh national park where Reg took the family on holidays once the Second World War was over.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Long-distance lorry driver Neil, 52, has fallen backwards off a ramp onto a concrete floor and is sent for an urgent CT scan, the results of which are a shock. Also receiving treatments are 29-year-old Ben, who has dislocated his shoulder in a cycling accident, and Wendy, 73, who is in resus with a severe open ankle fracture after falling at home.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Twenty-year-old Antonio is rushed to A&E after a motorcycle accident leaves him with a severe fracture to his leg and the medical team are concerned about a potential arterial bleed. Meanwhile, doctors investigate the damage to the chest and lungs of 40-year-old Karen, who fell off her horse, which then trampled on her, while leukaemia patient Hayley, 29, comes to St George's with wife Emma after suffering an infection and low immune system.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan continues to hang out with a selection of the richest people in the world, including two men who made their millions from selling sex toys, a woman who creates luxury creams from bee venom and a man who designs the most exclusive cars on the planet.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Brothel
programme.desc: Documentary charting the day-to-day workings of a Sheffield massage parlour run by a mother and daughter, revealing the struggle to fill the daily rota and how management deal with problem clients. The programme also explores the lives of the women who advertise their services and for whom sex is just a job.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Rory is upset to discover Lorelai has rekindled her relationship with Max and that Lane and Dean have become study partners. In a foul mood, she has a heated argument with her mother, before fleeing to her grandparents' house. Drama, starring Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary series giving an insight into the world of debt collection from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments. Brian and Graham have been warned to expect trouble as they evict some tenants from a south London flat, one of whom has a reputation for violence. Everything goes smoothly until the enforcement agents make a shocking discovery in a child's bedroom. Paul and Steve head to Slough to collect wages owed to a freelance worker, but the debtor is less than happy to find the high-court enforcement officers on his doorstep and things get physical.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: A vacancy opens in the studio's coveted trio when Paige loses her spot to undergo foot surgery, and the demanding mothers battle to claim the place for their own daughters.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.desc: Toadie is desperate to get in touch with Sonya, but Mark holds him responsible for her stress and the marriage seems in tatters. Jack begs Paige to reconsider leaving Erinsborough.(n)

programme.desc: Phoebe discovers a jewellery box at Justin's house and fears she is about to receive a marriage proposal, while VJ and Billie are struggling to come to terms with parenthood.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: The highly strung mothers become even more anxious when they discover that a scout from the Joffrey Ballet School will be attending the finals.(n)

programme.desc: The stylists give 24-year-old nightclub security guard Abbey a make-under, before trying to show recent graduate Phoenix how to be creative with different colours and styles.(n)

programme.title: The Magicians
programme.desc: Quentin meets a surprise guest at Alice's memorial, Julia encounters the witch who banished Reynard and Fillory's royalty are duped by their neighbours in the north.(n)

programme.title: Emerald City
programme.desc: The Wizard sends out Eamonn to take every little girl from her family, and Dorothy, Lucas, Sylvie and Toto visit Glinda, whom the Wizard thinks is behind the secret witch cabal.(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: A disillusioned office worker grows weary of his humdrum existence, but after meeting the mysterious Tyler Durden he finds fulfilment in establishing a club where similarly frustrated men come to vent their anger in bouts of bare-knuckle fighting. Satirical drama, directed by David Fincher, starring Edward Norton, Brad Pitt, Helena Bonham Carter, Meat Loaf and Jared Leto.(n)

programme.title: Feast of Love
programme.desc: A meditation on love and its various incarnations, set within a community of friends in Oregon and is described as an exploration of the magical, mysterious and sometimes painful incarnations of love(n)

programme.title: Johnny Handsome
programme.desc: A physically deformed criminal is caught and nearly killed after being double-crossed by his partners. Offered cosmetic surgery to give him a fresh chance at life, he is tempted by revenge(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A stranger steps in to save a pregnant woman from hitman Hertz. He delivers her baby and takes off, pursued by the killer and his henchmen(n)

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: Western drama about notorious train robber Jesse James, who welcomes a new gang member, unaware that Bob Ford is planning to kill him(n)

programme.title: Search Party
programme.desc: Distraught over the realisation that they scared away their best friend's fiancée, hard-partying friends Evan and Jason set out on a wild journey to reunite the estranged couple by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Rusty Griswold, the youngest child from 1983's National Lampoon's Vacation is all grown up with a family of his own and fond childhood memories of a certain family road trip to Walley World, "America's Favorite Family Fun Park." Like his father, Clark (Chevy Chase), Rusty wants to forge closer bonds with his own family - wife Debbie (Christina Applegate) and boys James and Kevin (Skyler Gisondo and Steele Stebbins) - so he buys a souped-up Albanian van and convinces them to set off on their own crazy cross-country jaunt to Walley World. Directed by John Francis Daley and Jonathan M. Goldstein(n)

programme.title: Sea of Love
programme.desc: A detective looking for a killer meets a seductive woman, who turns out to be a possible suspect in this romantically charged crime drama(n)

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: Can a high-attitude African-American politician who says what he thinks stand a chance in a presidential campaign? Mays Gilliam (Chris Rock) is a straight-talking alderman representing a inner-city neighborhood in Washington, D.C. In the midst of a hard-fought race for the White House, the Democratic presidential and vice-presidential candidates are killed in an airline crash, and with little time to prepare a new campaign, the Republican candidate, Vice President Brian Lewis (Nick Searcy), seems all but guaranteed to win. With practically nothing to loose, party head Martin Geller (Dylan Baker) approaches Gilliam and asks him to stand as the Democrat's presidential candidate. While Gilliam is dubious at first, before long his streetwise style and willingness to face the issues head-on earns him surprising figures in the polls, especially after he persuades his short-fused older brother, Mitch Gilliam (Bernie Mac), to join the ticket as vice presidential candidate -- a big jump for a bail bondsman. Gilliam's love life also becomes more complicated as his ex-girlfriend Kim (Robin Givens) decides she wants him back now that he has a shot at the White House, even though Gilliam only has eyes for Lisa (Tamala Jones). Head of State marked the directorial debut for comic and actor Chris Rock, who also co-wrote and co-produced the film(n)

programme.title: The Good Shepherd
programme.desc: A bright student's life is dramatically changed when he is invited to join Skull and Bones, Yale University's powerful secret society. The next 30 years are filled with espionage, secrets and scandal, and the ultimate evolution of the CIA(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Best friends, a priest (Norton) and a rabbi (Stiller) both fall in love with the same girl (Elfman). However, neither of the men can pursue the relationship due to their religious beliefs: the priest cannot break his vow of celibacy and the rabbi cannot marry her since she is not Jewish(n)

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: JM Barrie was the Scottish playwright who was inspired to write Peter Pan after befriending Sylvia and her three small children. Magical family drama nominated for seven Academy Awards(n)

programme.title: Renaissance Man
programme.desc: An out-of-work exec reluctantly takes a job teaching English to a group of underachieving Army recruits to help them complete basic training. He bonds with them by introducing them to Shakespeare, and clashes with an unimpressed Drill Sergeant(n)

programme.title: Juno
programme.desc: Juno may seem wise beyond her years, but after sleeping with classmate Bleeker, the pregnant teen quickly realises how little she really knows about life. Thankfully, Juno has been blessed with parents who trust their daughter's judgment, and a best friend named Leah, who's always willing to help out in a pinch(n)

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: In this millennial screwball comedy, Tracy (Lola Kirke), a mousy college freshman living on her own in New York City meets Brooke (Greta Gerwig), her stepsister-to-be, and is soon entranced by her worldliness and flummoxed by her impulsive nature. Written and Directed by Noah Baumbach(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: To ease their roommate through a relationship-induced depression, Christina Walters and Courtney Rockcliffe take her out on the town. During their attempts to find her "Mr. Right Now", Christina Walters meets Peter Donahue. Missing her opportunity with him that night, Christina Walters is talked into pursuing him to his brother's wedding. The ensuing road trip packs even more slapstick and locker room humour into an "already bursting" movie(n)

Widely acknowledged as one of director Martin Scorsese's best films and one of the landmarks of 1970s cinema(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A psychotherapist is shot dead, and his wife stands trial for murder when it is revealed the man was involved in an inappropriate relationship with one of his teenage clients. However, when the widow reveals she was also one of the doctor's victims in her youth, the DA's office is forced to prove that childhood traumas are no excuse for killing someone.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: The team investigates a case involving police officer Kevin Hopkins, who shot and killed a man while pursuing him following the burglary of a jewellery shop. Hopkins asserts that his actions were in self-defence - but his partner claims he did not hear an initial gunshot from the victim, whose hands also test negative for residue from the weapon. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

Meanwhile, the day of the Art Walk arrives, and a visiting artist catches Maryellen's eye. Drama, starring Andie MacDowell.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order

Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

Drama, starring Jessica Steen.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee feels the pressure as the team investigates a double murder that appears to be inspired by his still unpublished new novel. American drama following the work of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service, starring Sean Murray and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In an effort to find the terrorist Parsa, Gibbs and the NCIS team track down one of his cohorts using evidence gleaned from the drone attack which has killed six people and wounded a further 22. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A gruesome work of art in a painter's studio leads to the discovery of a woman's body in the flat above. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A couple confront a businessman who is trying to break into their car, only to discover he has been stabbed. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: Your mind is the scene of the crime. Box-office superstar Leonardo DiCaprio stars in this contemporary science fiction action film set within the architecture of the mind. Written, directed and produced by Oscar® and Golden Globe nominee Christopher Nolan (The Dark Knight, Batman Begins, The Prestige), this eagerly awaited follow-up to 2008's billion-dollar blockbuster is yet another visionary tale from a startingly original filmmaker who continually raises the bar with every film he makes. Shooting in London, Paris, Tangiers, Calgary and Los Angeles, Nolan's mind-bending film also stars Academy Award® winners Michael Caine and Marion Cotillard, in addition to Juno's Ellen Page, Batman Begins' Cillian Murphy and Oscar® nominees Ken Watanabe (The Last Samurai) and Tom Berenger (Platoon)(n)

programme.title: The Departed
programme.desc: After being nominated seven times to the Oscars, Martin Scorsese won the Best Director statuette for this crime thriller starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson and Mark Wahlberg, among other stars. Billy Costigan is a police officer assigned to work undercover with Irish mobster Frank Costello to get evidences to arrest him. On the other side, Colin Sullivan, the informer of Costello, is promoted in the Massachusetts State Police. The Departed also received the Best Picture Academy Award(n)

programme.title: The Rock

programme.desc: Martin Scorsese's violent life story of gangster-turned-FBI informant Henry Hill (Ray Liotta) follows his rise from street kid to wise guy, partnered by Oscar- winning Joe Pesci. Working with Robert De Niro for local capo Paul Sorvino, Hill realises he will never be a made man and, under pressure from both the mob and the feds, turns informer(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek horror tale in which a small Nevada desert town is terrorised by giant man-eating worms. Two handymen are forced to postpone their plans to escape their humdrum lives after several mysterious deaths and a series of earthquakes turn out to be the work of predatory subterranean creatures which lay siege to the terrified townsfolk(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Thirteen
programme.desc: All-star heist sequel. The remaining members of Danny Ocean's gang regroup to jeopardise the nefarious plans of a businessman who double-crossed one of Danny's old friends. The team plan to ruin the opening of his glitzy Las Vegas casino and hotel by rigging the games and ensuring that every punter goes home with a jackpot. Director: Steven Soderbergh (Conclusion of tonight's film)(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: John Farley (Sean William Scott) has overcome years of childhood and teenage humiliation and has fashioned himself into a self-help author who guides others towards releasing their painful memories and rebuilding their self-esteem. However, his miserable past sneaks up on him when he returns to his hometown only to find that his mother is marrying Mr. Woodcock (Billy Bob Thornton), the tough gym teacher who was the source of his school years' woes. Determined to stop his mother from marrying the man who made school a living hell for him, John is going to need all the self-help he can get. The cast of this outrageous comedy is rounded up by Susan Sarandon, Amy Poehler and Ethan Suplee(n)

programme.title: Tremors 3: Back to Perfection
programme.desc: Gun-toting adventurer Burt Gummer returns to his home town of Perfection, where he battles the newest flying mutation of giant killer sandworms with the help of a lowly tour guide. Meanwhile, crooked land developers are planning to turn the area into a money-spinning tourist trap(n)

programme.title: Marauders

programme.title: MI-5
programme.desc: In this spy-thriller former MI-5 agent Will Holloway (Kit Harington) is forced to partner with Harry Pierce (Peter Firth), the MI5 Intelligence Chief who decommissioned him, to apprehend a terrorist Adem Qasim (Elyes Gabel) who escaped during routine prisoner transport. A disgraced Harry faked his death after the Qasim escaped and Will was brought back into the MI-5 fold to locate Harry and return him to headquarters. Harry convinces Will that there is a traitor in MI-5 and they must work together to prevent a terrorist attack on the city of London. The film is based on the British television series Spooks created by David Wolstencroft. Directed by Bharat Nalluri. Cast includes Lara Pulver, David Harewood and Jennifer Ehle(n)

Writer-director Guillermo del Toro's sequel improves on his original, showcasing wickedly elegant monsters and spectacular action sequences(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: One of the most celebrated horror films of the late '70s is given a new look in this remake, produced by blockbuster filmmaker Michael Bay. George and Kathy Lutz (Ryan Reynolds and Melissa George) are a young couple who are looking for a new home, and think they've found a dream house in Amityville, Long Island -- a large and beautiful home available at a bargain price. George thinks that there must be a catch, and learns that the house has a dark history -- a year before, a man living in the house murdered his family in their sleep, claiming he was commanded to commit the crime by demons. Shrugging off stories that the house is haunted, George and Kathy move in with their three kids, only to discover that something evil lurks within the house, and even Father McNamara (Philip Baker Hall), an expert on possession, is powerless to clear the dark spirits from the home. The Amityville Horror was based on the same book by Jay Anson that provided the basis for the 1979 film, which in turn documented an actual incident(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Officers in Amsterdam search for a Liverpool drugs baron, while the Metropolitan police are hunting down two American brothers who fled the US while awaiting trial.(n)

programme.desc: Matt Allwright learns how a man has taken it upon himself to track down lethal counterfeit booze after his 23-year-old daughter was fatally poisoned by fake gin. Plus, the presenter reveals the extraordinary levels of food forgery across the UK.(n)

programme.desc: Gary Pe and Danny Sebastian help two teams search for items at the Westpoint Arena in Exeter, while presenter Natasha Raskin learns about the history of weaving in Axminster.(n)

programme.desc: A desperate Emma goes too far in trying to forget her troubles, and Daniel mocks Zara when she tells him she is going to try a new approach with patients.(n)

programme.desc: A London couple search West Sussex for properties within their £1.1million budget. Nicki Chapman is their guide, and also goes bell-ringing at Chichester Cathedral.(n)

programme.desc: Anita Manning and Nick Davies are in Reading, Berkshire, to value items including 19th-century French paperweights, while presenter Paul Martin visits Cliveden House.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Michelle Ackerley present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: A report on the events of last Wednesday, when Khalid Masood drove his car at pedestrians on Westminster Bridge before fatally stabbing PC Keith Palmer in the Palace of Westminster.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle reaches breaking point as she grows increasingly jealous of Preston and Bex's relationship, and suggests to a confused Martin that the teenage American might not be right for his daughter. However, things soon reach a head at the Carters' latest theme night, where Michelle's secret looks set to explode. Meanwhile, Tina is thrown when she learns social services are coming to assess Sylvie tomorrow, and Kush supports Denise after only a few people turn up for her community meeting - and the pair are soon struggling to resist each other.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: An audience in Birmingham is given a chance to have a say at a hugely significant moment in British history, with the Government about to trigger Article 50 and start the process of leaving the European Union after the win for the Leave campaign in the vote held on June 23 last year. David Dimbleby hosts this special edition of the programme, which gives members of the public the chance to put questions about the implications of Brexit to a panel of senior politicians from both of the EU referendum campaigns.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Mrs Brown's Boys creator, writer and star Brendan O'Carroll dons Agnes's famous cardigan and curlers once again, throwing open the doors of the larger-than-life Irish matriarch's home to host a Saturday night chat show, filmed in front of a live studio audience. She begins by inviting actress Pamela Anderson, tennis coach Judy Murray and entertainments manager and TV personality Louis Walsh, among others to join her in the sitting room.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Phil Wang and broadcaster Janet Street-Porter joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: Angela Rippon returns to the area where she grew up in Devon to look at the different ways people choose to retire, and helps out as a volunteer at a charity shop.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin visit properties up for auction in East Sussex, Norbury in London and Dudley in the West Midlands.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: The hunt for fugitive Robert Knight in Spain and the search in Worcestershire for a 33-year-old drug dealer who has already been sentenced to two years prison back in Poland.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates lorry drivers who falsify their working hours records, and finds out what effect this can have on innocent road users. The presenter also examines how bogus degrees are damaging Britain's job market, and speaks to family members who were left stranded at an airport after receiving counterfeit holiday tickets.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents from the East of England Showground in Peterborough, where antiques experts Philip Serrell and Mark Stacey guide a team of reds and a team of blues as they hunt for profitable items to take to auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Emma fears for her career and tries to stop Jimmi from telling the Partners what she did yesterday, while Zara hatches a new plan, and JJ is worried about his future with Mrs Tembe.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Julian from Westhoughton answers questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright hosts, with expert help from Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple find a country home in rural Herefordshire on a £500,000 budget and samples a potent drink produced by one pioneering farm in the county.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a tip in Altrincham, Greater Manchester - an old leather sofa, a Victorian cabinet and an Arts and Crafts-style bench.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Revisiting locations from the series, including Herstmonceux Castle and Greenwich Royal Naval College, while Paul Martin uncovers the story of Richard Acland in Killerton, Devon.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Michelle Ackerley present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: With the truth is out in the open, Michelle's world comes crashing down and she is forced to face her family and friends. But as the pressure rises she loses control - leading to disastrous consequences. Meanwhile, Denise insists that she and Kush should remain friends, while Whitney supports Tina, who is upset at the thought of Sylvie going into care.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Dom and Isaac clash professionally over a patient's treatment, leaving Dom to reconsider their personal relationship. When Dom takes a stand against Isaac and confronts him, he finds himself at the receiving end of his boyfriend's temper. Serena is dealt a further blow when a patient arrives on AAU serving as a reminder of Elinor's recent death. Meanwhile, a drunken mistake prompts Ollie to take a big step in his relationship with Zosia.(n)

programme.title: Rio Ferdinand: Being Mum and Dad
programme.desc: The former footballer Rio Ferdinand lost his 34-year-old wife Rebecca to cancer in May 2015, and a year on he is still coming to terms with his loss, and the effect it has had upon himself and his three children. Rio meets other families coping with bereavement, and looks at what help is available for parents and children who have experienced loss to move on with their lives.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: The Spy in the IRA - Panorama.
programme.desc: The story behind one of Britain's most important spies since the Second World War. Code-named Stakeknife, Freddie Scappaticci worked for the IRA for decades, in charge of rooting out and executing suspected informers - but he was also spying for the British security services. Scappaticci denies the allegations, but is now the subject of a £35million criminal inquiry. Reporter John Ware investigates how Stakeknife operated, why his crimes were ignored and why he has been protected for so long.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: The work of extradition units in the UK and Europe. A six-month search for a Polish murderer leads DS Pete Rance and his team to a flat in south-west London.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Metropolitan Police officers seek a man accused of a murder in Poland, while detectives in West Yorkshire try to find a man accused of stealing and killing pigs in Hungary.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Upcycling expert Sarah Moore tasks carpenter Norman Wilkinson with reimagining an old wall cabinet, while she takes on the challenge of restyling a fashion mannequin.(n)

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The remaining two designers battle to be crowned champion in the grand final of the competition. Standing in between them and the title is the challenge of transforming three rooms in apartments in an 18th-century mock castle in Broadstairs. To make the challenge more difficult than ever, the rooms are larger than before and for the first time, each designer will be tackling a kitchen. As the race for the title nears its end, the pair must impress Daniel Hopwood and Kelly Hoppen, as well as former judge and interior stylist Sophie Robinson. Presented by Tom Dyckhoff. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Building Dream Homes
programme.desc: Edinburgh-based architect David Blaikie forges ahead with the modern extension that will double the size of a couple's historic home, but money is tight and the pressures of the build push the family to breaking point. In Dorset, Paul Robinson and Laurence Bowen design a state-of-the-art house, but horrific weather and complicated nature of the construction threaten to derail the whole project.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Writer and comedy actor Adil Ray joins Brian Conley to discuss the shows of his youth, and to explain how the Liverpool-set Bread inspired him to create Asian sitcom Citizen Khan.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Coronation Street star William Roache, who has played Ken Barlow since the soap began in 1960, learns about his family's entrepreneurial past. He discovers the cafe his grandmother Zillah Waddicor ran on the site of Alton Towers in the 1920s and 30s was a far more ambitious business than he had been led to believe, and learns about the challenges she faced in her personal and professional lives. He also delves into the story of his great-grandfather James, a trader who dealt in some highly unusual wares in late 19th-century Blackpool.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Adam deals with a life-saving emergency when a dog is hit by a train, and in Teesside, Richard artificially inseminates Welsh black cattle. Meanwhile, at the rural practice Steve tries to clip a budgerigar's claws. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough documents the universal tale that unites humanity with every other animal on the planet - the journey through life, and the goal to continue the bloodline through offspring. This edition focuses on the first hurdle any animal will face, surviving infancy. Cameras follow flightless barnacle goose chicks as they strive to find food, leaping 400ft down a cliff from the ledge where they hatched. Meanwhile, in New Zealand, young fur seals have stumbled across a safe haven in which they can learn how to avoid predators, while deep in the Gobi Desert, the long-eared jerboa learns to use its impeccable hearing to catch insect pray. Plus, albatross chicks make their first flight, as threatening tiger sharks wait patiently for them to slip up and land in the sea.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Philip Serrell embark on another trip, travelling through the Lake District and West Yorkshire before ending at their first auction in Cleveleys, Lancashire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: New series. A team of experts tries to restore family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory, beginning with a clock, a carving of a flying fish and an accordion.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Matt LeBlanc compete in a race across the Arabian peninsula, pitting a Bugatti Chiron against an assortment of other ways of travelling - with money no object. Rory Reid creates a life-size arcade game to put city cars to the test, and Tinie Tempah takes a ride on the Top Gear track in a Toyota GT86.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The first semi-final takes place as two teams of four students compete to make it to the final of the competition, which was won last year by Peterhouse, Cambridge. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: The food writer shares ideas to make everyday family meals special with no-fuss dishes and also tries her hand at milking a goat before showing her granddaughter how to make her own goat's cheese for a family picnic.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: New series. Giles Coren and Monica Galetti join the staff working in some of the most extraordinary hotels around the world, beginning with Marina Bay Sands in Singapore, which employs 9,500 people and caters for a million guests a year. Their duties include acting as attendants at the world's largest infinity pool, working as a butler under a former special forces officer, and joining a catering team that provides Brazilian, Chinese, French and Japanese cuisine for 60 restaurants.(n)

programme.title: Cradle to Grave
programme.desc: The Bakers find themselves living double lives as Fred starts work as a commissionaire - only to come into conflict with the manager - and Danny is mistaken for David Essex's brother, something he willingly exploits when he realises how much it impresses the girls. However, Bet might be living the most dangerous lie of all with her friendship with Keith from work.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: Imagine: A Picture of the Painter Howard Hodgkin.
programme.desc: Alan Yentob's 2006 profile of the reclusive artist, who died earlier this month. Featuring contributions by Seamus Heaney, William Boyd, Julian Barnes and Colm Toibin.(n)

programme.title: Incredible Medicine: Dr Weston's Casebook
programme.desc: Gabriel Weston continues to unlock the secrets of the human body, investigating some of the most extraordinary cases in medicine. First, she hears the story of a man with bones much stronger than the norm, and a girl whose arm will not stop growing. Dr Weston also learns of a woman who became pregnant with twins, but in two separate wombs, and a woman with a condition that means she is able to get lost within her own home.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Anita Rani present the show from the Hoo Peninsula, reporting on the influence of the local `salt shepherds' and efforts to protect the birds that flock to the area. Plus, there are new arrivals on Adam Henson's farm, and Tom Heap reveals what Britain leaving the EU will mean for the country's migrant labour force and the farmers who employ them.(n)

programme.title: Shop Well for Less
programme.desc: The One Show presenter Alex Jones and business journalist Steph McGovern take on a mission to help families change the way they shop without changing their lifestyles. They begin in Glasgow, where Colin and Karen Rodger dream of taking their three sets of twins abroad for the first time. However, they are big spenders, with Karen's shoe addiction rubbing off onto the children, while Colin opts for only the very best when it comes to gadgets. To help them save money, they have their branded products replaced with substitutes, and also test cheaper vacuums and washing detergents. Will they be able to change their spendthrift ways?.(n)

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: Sara Cox invites 10 home pottery enthusiasts to gather in Stoke-on-Trent for the second series of the competition to find a champion of British pottery. They will be judged on their craft skills and creativity by ceramic artist Kate Malone and master potter Keith Brymer Jones - and things get under way with a challenge to produce a 16-piece dinner set. After this they must decorate a pair of jugs and then demonstrate their prowess at the wheel by throwing the tallest cone they can in 15 minutes.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Officers in Amsterdam search for a Liverpool drugs baron, while the Metropolitan police are hunting down two American brothers who fled the US while awaiting trial.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms three items reclaimed from a tip in Witley, Surrey with screen printer Daniel Heath given the task of making a wooden tea trolley desirable again.(n)

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup and Rev Richard Coles challenge the artists to capture the human body in motion, and a solo dancer is brought in to perform for them for two hours. This is only the warm-up for a far greater challenge, when an entire troupe of ballerinas put in an appearance and perform an extract from Swan Lake while the painters try and depict their movements.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces highlights of Wigan Warriors v Hull FC at the DW Stadium and Castleford Tigers v Catalans Dragons at the Mend-a-Hose Jungle. Plus, action from Huddersfield Giants v Leeds Rhinos at the John Smith's Stadium and St Helens v Warrington Wolves at the Totally Wicked Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The presenters are in Hampshire, where Matt Baker helps out on HMS Warrior, and Julia Bradbury tells the story of the Cockleshell Heroes.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Former politician and Strictly star Ann Widdecombe tells Brian Conley about significant TV shows and characters from her past, including sailing soap Howards' Way, music and entertainment show Six-Five Special, Richard Chamberlain as Dr Kildare and 1960 biblical drama Paul of Tarsus.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Actress Celia Imrie always knew she came from a long line of aristocrats on her mother's side but has resisted finding out any more about her illustrious heritage, fearing her ancestors will turn out to be stuffy and boring. Now she finally sets out on that journey and is quickly proved wrong as she traces her family back to the 17th century, uncovering stories of political intrigue and impotence. She discovers one ancestor who broke all the rules and ended up in the Tower of London, and explores the extraordinary legacy of another who was accused of plotting to kill a king.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Vet Megan treats a Great Dane with a life-threatening condition in Fife, and in the countryside Richard inspects a herd of cows to see how many are pregnant and fits nose rings to some of the bulls. Plus, Steve meets a rabbit with wonky teeth. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough details the transition animals go through as they grow into adults. Looking at examples including a tiger cub whose family is under threat, a vulnerable veined octopus and a pair of sibling cheetahs guarding against starvation, the veteran naturalist illustrates how they develop new skills and learn how to survive on their own.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Philip Serrell visit Barnard Castle in Co Durham, and try to uncover some hidden gems to take to auction in Driffield, East Yorkshire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Will Kirk restore a piano stool, clock restoration expert Steve works on a vintage telephone and antique projector specialist Richard Rigby enlivens a magic lantern.(n)

programme.title: The Best of British Takeaways
programme.desc: Chef Tom Kerridge tries to find out what makes the best Indian curry and uncovers the trade secrets behind our takeaways, while Cherry Healey explores the fascinating stories that helped shape our communities as well as our palates, and learns how Queen Victoria put curry on the British menu. Three award-winning Indian takeaways are then invited to compete in a contest in Bradford, each with their own ideas as to what makes the best takeaway, with Enam Ali acting as judge to decide the winner. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Stargazing Live
programme.desc: New series. Professor Brian Cox and Dara O Briain travel to Australia to explore the night skies, with the programme joining them as they finish a long night under the stars and as dawn approaches. Brian and Dara are joined by Liz Bonnin on a remote mountain top in New South Wales, site of the world-famous Siding Spring Observatory, and will have Australian outback astronomer Greg Quicke as their guide to the southern sky, revealing some of the wonderful star tales told by indigenous people.(n)

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Detectives investigate a shooting at the Eureka Gardens apartment complex in Jacksonville, Florida, where three gunmen have fired more than 50 rounds at a group of 10 people, including a baby. Despite numerous witnesses, nobody will talk to the police for fear of retribution, leaving the detectives to knock on doors in the hope that somebody breaks. This tension is mirrored in the courtroom at the trial of Lenard Anderson, who is accused of shooting another black man in a strip club.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Christine Clarke brings a man back to her flat from a New Year's Eve party and her life immediately starts to unravel. Who is the terrifying stranger who keeps appearing in the apartment at night? Darkly comic tale by Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, starring Sheridan Smith, Tom Riley and Michele Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the presenter explores the country that lies at the crossroads between Europe and Asia, and discovers the dramatic changes it is undergoing. The first leg of his journey begins in Istanbul, from which he travels along the Aegean coast to the hostile border with Syria. He meets refugees trying to start a new life and a billionaire taking advantage of a property boom. He moves on into the Taurus Mountains and the Black Sea Coast, and visits a community trying to keep an ancient language alive.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great Irish Journeys with Martha Kearney
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues to trace the footsteps of 19th-century artist and geologist George Victor Du Noyer, who spent 35 years charting the landscape, people and buildings of Ireland. Martha travels north, taking in the extraordinary beauty of Dunluce Castle, and onwards to Mussenden Temple, pondering its unusual location. She also marvels at how Belfast was shaped by the Victorians, visits Kearney Point on the Ards Peninsula and journeys south to Dunmoe, which overlooks the site of the Battle of the Boyne.(n)

programme.title: Racing Legends
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood explores the life and times of the motorsport great, who died earlier this month. To gain an insight into one of Britain's greatest sportsmen, Paul takes to the track and the Isle of Man circuit to recreate some of John's finest moments, while the man himself looks back on a life filled with danger, glamour and intrigue. With contributions from Surtees' wife and daughters as well as rivals and commentators.(n)

programme.title: Crash and Burn
programme.desc: Documentary charting the story of professional motor racing driver Tommy Byrne, who during the 1980s went from stock-car racing to big-time Formula One in a little over four years. But while his rise was meteoric, his fall was just as spectacular.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary about the effects that long-term solitary confinement have on prisoners, following recently released prisoners when they go from isolation to the streets. The film examines the psychological impact of solitary, the baggage offenders carry with them back into the community and whether this type of imprisonment makes the general public more or less safe.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: In the second of two episodes examining the Indian Ocean, Paul Rose, Philippe Cousteau Jr, Dr Lucy Blue and Tooni Mahto explore the impact the ocean's tides and currents have on coastal areas. They join a group of scientists working on an experiment to predict extreme weather, and dive down to a coral colony - an environment in which they can learn about changes in the planet's climate.(n)

programme.title: Inside Porton Down: Britain's Secret Weapons Research Facility
programme.desc: Dr Michael Mosley investigates Britain's most secretive and controversial military research base, Porton Down, on its 100th anniversary. He comes face to face with chemical and biological weapons old and new, reveals the truth about animal and human testing, and discovers how the latest science and technology are helping to defend the UK against terrorist attacks and rogue nations.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: The Power of the Placebo.
programme.desc: As they contain no active ingredient, placebo medicines and pills should not really work, but they are now being shown to be effective in helping treat pain and depression and even alleviating some of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease. This programme explores why they work and how everyone could benefit from them.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary about the effects that long-term solitary confinement have on prisoners, following recently released prisoners when they go from isolation to the streets. The film examines the psychological impact of solitary, the baggage offenders carry with them back into the community and whether this type of imprisonment makes the general public more or less safe.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great Irish Journeys with Martha Kearney
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues to trace the footsteps of 19th-century artist and geologist George Victor Du Noyer, examining places of power as seen through his eyes. She traces the movement of power from Newgrange, Co Meath, through the Rock of Cashel, sees Waterford Charter Roll and ends up at Castletown House in Co Kildare.(n)

programme.title: 1066: A Year to Conquer England
programme.desc: Docudrama in which Dan Snow explores the political intrigues and family betrayals between Vikings, Anglo-Saxons and Normans that led to the Battle of Hastings. The first edition reveals how the death of Edward the Confessor without an heir triggered a bitter race to succeed him as king of England, with Earl Harold successfully taking the crown. However, William of Normandy believes the throne has been promised to him and decides to invade, while Viking king Harald Hardrada also fancies himself as monarch.(n)

programme.title: Gravity and Me: The Force that Shapes our Lives
programme.desc: Jim Al-Khalili investigates the amazing science of gravity, recreating groundbreaking experiments, including the moment when Galileo first worked out how to measure it. He investigates gravity waves, finds out from astronauts what it's like to live without gravity, sets out to find where in Britain gravity is weakest and so where we weigh the least, and helps design a smartphone app that volunteers use to demonstrate how gravity affects time and makes us age at slightly different rates.(n)

programme.title: Television's Opening Night: How the Box Was Born
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell, Professor Danielle George and Dr Hugh Hunt mark the 80th anniversary of Britain's very first TV broadcast by trying to recreate the landmark event. The inaugural programme came live from Alexandria Palace on November 2, 1936, but there are no surviving recordings of the show. In response, the presenter trio set out to recreate every aspect of this first broadcast, from the variety acts featured right down to the camera equipment used, using authentic technology and filming techniques. Plus, pioneering TV engineer John Logie Baird's assistant - now aged 104 - is on hand to lend some technical assistance, and Dallas meets a one of the performers who appeared on the first programme to find out what it is like to be part of TV history.(n)

programme.desc: The discovery of a dead marine intelligence officer in a motel room sets the team off on a hunt for her killer. programme.desc: CIA agent Trent Kort returns to track down dangerous criminal Jonathan Siravo and Gibbs is forced to put his personal feelings aside to assist in the investigation. programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Sloan's birthday turns out to be less than festive when he discovers the dead body of a prominent divorce lawyer in the hospital pharmacy. programme.sub-title: The Only Easy Day Is Yesterday.

Eric studies the details of his unit and finds that a man called Jackson has been unaccounted for since the day of the attack. Drama, starring LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

In an attempt to win the confidence of the buyer, Ducky poses as an ageing Englishman trying to sell the information. Guest starring Armand Assante, with David McCallum and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Sloan's birthday turns out to be less than festive when he discovers the dead body of a prominent divorce lawyer in the hospital pharmacy. When Steve arrives, however, the evidence is nowhere to be found. Mark and Jack work feverishly to recover the missing body, find the culprit, and lead a tour of potential investors at the same time. Dick Van Dyke stars as the medical sleuth.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A man arrives in town planning to kill a man he has never met, but ends up falling in love with the wife of his intended victim.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: One of Jamie's classmates witnesses a brutal murder, but is too terrified to recount what has happened. Meanwhile, the killer is hired as a helping hand at the Ponderosa.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An army scientist goes missing, so Abby is asked to temporarily replace him on a top-secret research project - but Gibbs later learns her assignment is connected to a current murder investigation, and worries she may meet the same fate as her predecessor. Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.sub-title: The Only Easy Day Is Yesterday.
programme.desc: Three men stage a raid on a drug deal, taking a suitcase full of cash and killing the dealer and an undercover LAPD officer. While studying footage taken from CCTV equipment in the house, Sam recognises the distinctive hand signals of one of the suspects as being those of Navy Seal Kurt Holgate, who he served with in Bosnia. Eric studies the details of his unit and finds that a man called Jackson has been unaccounted for since the day of the attack. Drama, starring LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: The IMF team take on the leader of a drug counterfeiting ring, trying to stop him before he can make a potentially deadly copy of a vital new medicine. To ensure success, Cinnamon poses as an employee of a pharmaceutical company to guard the real drugs.(n)

programme.title: JAG
programme.desc: Harm defends a Navy Seal whose negligence has resulted in the death of a fellow officer. Meanwhile, Chegwidden hits a disrespectful school student and is immediately put under pressure to resign. Military legal drama, starring David James Eliott.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team attend the funeral of a fallen colleague before resuming their hunt for the man they believe to be the port-to-port killer. Vance frantically researches the suspect's background to learn more about his motivations and discover who his next target could be - but one of the investigators follows a clue that leads to danger.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: A TV star is caught on camera fleeing the scene of her former husband's murder, but Dr Sloan suspects she may have been framed. Guest starring Morgan Fairchild.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Trivette, Walker, CD and Alex are trapped in a vacant lodge by a drug trafficker seen dealing. Chuck Norris, Noble Willingham and Clarence Gilyard star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: On a live-fire air force training exercise, someone hacks into the control systems of a drone and fires one of its two live missiles, striking and killing a serviceman, before piloting it away. Sam and Callen meet with a member of the National Security Agency, while Eric's inquiries lead him to a group of students on an advanced computer science course and Kensi is sent under cover to pose as its guest speaker.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. When the body of a marine is found strung up at a construction site, the agents travel to LA to work with another NCIS team on an investigation into an international arms deal that escalates into a high-priority case, and Tony begins to pry into Ziva's life. Guest starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J (NCIS: Los Angeles).(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: Jim Phelps uncovers a plot to assassinate a Soviet defector in a sleepy mountain village, but is captured and drugged by an enemy agent. Rollin mobilises the team to rescue him and foil the murderous plot. Peter Graves, Martin Landau and Peter Lupus star.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Arthur is picked for jury duty, while Carrie is disappointed with Doug, who sends her flowers and chocolates - but only after she has reminded him of the lack of romance in their relationship.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie decides to get her own back for missing out on a trip to Paris, determined to make Doug pay for insisting they go on a motorhome holiday. Kevin James and Leah Remini star.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug learns Carrie is turned on by an Italian accent he has mastered, but worries that she is falling out of love with his real self, while Arthur finds inspiration between the covers of a book. Kevin James and Leah Remini star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Marie shame Ray into giving Robert a second bachelor party to make up for his disappointing first attempt.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part one of two. Robert and Amy prepare to tie the knot in a classic Barone family wedding ceremony - but the groom becomes suspicious when his future brother-in-law Peter tries to make peace with both him and Ray. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Brad Garrett.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Charlotte accepts a lift to the railway station from Frasier, but his car breaks down in a desolate area and they end up spending the night in the same room as a dead body. Meanwhile, confusion arises as Niles plans Martin's stag party.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink considers throwing away an old broken pot until it stirs up fond memories, including the time he was accidentally glued to a blind date and a Thanksgiving when everyone seemed to be down on their luck. American comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of the owners of Hannah & Mason's, a French bistro in Cranbury, New Jersey. Members of staff complain their pay cheques bounce, and the kitchen cooler is so unhygienic that Gordon makes the decision to close the restaurant on Valentine's Day - the busiest night of the year.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller tends a parakeet with a broken leg and a much-loved cat that needs its thyroid gland removed, while the vet's own puppy is rushed in after swallowing a baby's dummy.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James Constantinou faces rare items that are allegedly from Arctic explorer Ernest Shackleton's expeditions and values some vintage Chanel handbags. He also discovers a problem when he takes assistant Jo out for a terrifying test drive in a client's Porsche.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game, with Dr Phil Hammond alongside Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Matt and Vicky Wade ask Casas Manuel to find them a holiday home with plenty of outside space for sunbathing, while Sharon shows her sister's friend three apartments in Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples host dinner parties in Bedfordshire, with Gavin and Jodie, Francis and Yvonne, and Lisa and Ed all competing for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer realises he has failed to do anything worthwhile with his life and decides to rectify matters by becoming a great inventor like Thomas Edison. Featuring the voice of William Daniels as KITT, Knight Rider's famous supercar.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: It is the day of Amy and Ryan's wedding, but Ryan has also got their potential move to America playing on his mind. Scott is having a fashion crisis and asks Mercedes for help, while Leela is put on the spot by a request from DS Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Antony Barnett investigates the multinational beverage corporation, which one of the world's most recognised brands.(n)

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade heads to the Canary Islands for a packed mini-break with actress and writer Lena Dunham, the star and creator of American comedy drama Girls. In the north of the island, Richard and Lena visit a guachinche pop-up restaurant, where they have goat stew before exploring the barren lunar-like landscape around the volcanic Mount Teide and spend the evening stargazing. There is also a sculpture tour, including works by Henry Moore and Joan Miro, as well as layered coffee, a spot of golf and a search for whales.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Long-distance lorry driver Neil, 52, has fallen backwards off a ramp onto a concrete floor and is sent for an urgent CT scan, the results of which are a shock. Also receiving treatments are 29-year-old Ben, who has dislocated his shoulder in a cycling accident, and Wendy, 73, who is in resus with a severe open ankle fracture after falling at home.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan continues to hang out with a selection of the richest people in the world, including two men who made their millions from selling sex toys, a woman who creates luxury creams from bee venom and a man who designs the most exclusive cars on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Tattoo Fixers
programme.desc: A self-professed mummy's boy asks Sketch to erase his misunderstood tattoo, while Jay sorts out martial arts fan Jimmy's naughty nod to Chuck Norris. Meanwhile, Alice helps Olivia, who has epilepsy, to get a tattoo to mark her journey, and it is game over for Will's drinking game disaster.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: Documentary providing access to the community of Rockland Ranch in the middle of the Utah desert, where 14 Mormon families have made a home for themselves. Half the men here are polygamists, including father-of-16 Enoch Foster. He is one of the most influential men in the community and has two wives, who adore him and each other. But their family is set to expand again, with baby number 17 on the way - and Enoch is also courting a third wife, 25-year-old nanny Lydia.(n)

programme.title: Gap Year
programme.desc: The gang goes on a trek and get lost in the Malaysian jungle, where Lauren discovers the truth about Dylan and Ashley, while Sean receives unexpected romantic attention.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the coastal community of Long Beach, California, to save an Italian restaurant that was opened in 1958 and now under the misguided leadership of Nino, who blamed by brother Michael and sister Carina for the eatery's failings. Their 78-year-old mother Inge desperate for Nino to turn the business around, but the feuding family members will have to solve their differences first.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick tends to a Newfoundland called Billy, who clocks up thousands of miles travelling back and forth from his home in Aberdeen for treatment on its legs. He also attempts to help Barney, a Yorkshire terrier that has a deformity in its neck that is compressing its spinal cord. For owners Linda and Barry, Noel is their last chance, but the operation involves high-risk surgery with no guarantee of success.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton revisits Liz and Robin Leonard, who planned to self-build a three-bedroom home in Hastings, East Sussex, and chose to ignore all the advice he gave them.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps a man try to sell his terraced house in Bolton and gives owner Danny some advice about the amount of attention his home needs if it is ever going to be sold.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Russell secures a collection of tropical trees that need moving from Gloucestershire to Kent, while Phil grapples with a dragon statue that requires transporting 213 miles from Altrincham, Cheshire, to Skewen in south Wales. Are Phil and Russell in with a chance of winning 'Transporter of the Week'?.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game, with Dr Phil Hammond alongside Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug gets carried away and tells too many home truths when he makes a speech at a celebratory dinner for his boss. Comedy, starring Kevin James and Tom Amandes.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug is unsettled to learn Carrie buys his clothes from an outsize shop, and when she tells him he should lose some weight, a bitter battle of wills ensues. Meanwhile, Arthur wages his own war against neighbourhood thugs with the aid of a limbless mannequin.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie returns to college, but discovers she does not have enough time to work and study. Meanwhile, Doug worries that an educated woman like her will not be interested in a blue-collar man like him. Ricki Lake guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part two of two. Robert and Amy finally get married in the Barone family tradition. Brad Garrett and Monica Horan star.(n)

programme.desc: Debra complains she and Ray do not have any fun together - and persuades him to let her join him in his game of golf. Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton star.(n)

programme.desc: Part one of two. Jason Biggs, Robbie Coltrane and Richard E Grant guest star alongside regulars Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney in the series' penultimate episode.(n)

Faced with an empty apartment, Frasier records his final radio show before jetting off to pastures new. Anthony LaPaglia and Richard E Grant guest star.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Italian family restaurant Sabatiello's in Stamford, Connecticut, where the owner's fiery temper upsets the staff and has left him more than $1million in debt. Gordon's help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him.(n)

programme.title: Mutiny
programme.desc: Nine men recreate a voyage by William Bligh in 1789, when he and his loyal crewmen crossed 4,000 miles of the Pacific ocean from Tonga to Timor after being cast adrift from HMS Bounty by mutinying officers and left for dead. programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: People struggling to live on the dole while also caring for their furry friends, including 33-year-old Sheffield woman Billie, who claims more than £5,000 a year and shares her one-bedroom council home with an astonishing 32 pets. Rugby husband and wife Kim and Gary claim £900 credit per month, but with debts of at least £2,000, they face the heart-breaking choice of losing either their home or some of their five pets. And depression-sufferer Paul prefers animals to people, finding comfort in caring for his 24 pets. He receive disability and employment support, but has been battling for some time to prove he is entitled to his benefits.(n)
